page.title: 14VALE ROYAL ABBEY, WHITEGATE
page.content: {(The Grounds) } The Abbey's grounds are approximately 33 acres. In the middle of the land there is a large pond with an abundance of fish and other wildlife. In the centre of this, there is a fountain. Also in the garden there is a monument which marks the grave of a nun - Ida - and it is thought to mark the high altar of the church that Edward 1 built. There is a helicopter pad and in the future, tennis courts and a swimming pool are going to be constructed. [Ida] Ida was in love with Father John. They ran away together because they could not marry. As punishment she was sent to a nunnery in Chester and with her consent John became Abbot Peter. When she died she was buried in the grounds.
